COMMENT_TX: ej,torrj101,M,denkd901,Balls and strikes Yankees manager Joe Torre ejected by HP umpire Don Denkinger sometime in third inning
ej,mclem001,P,roe-r901,Balls and strikes Mark McLemore ejected by HP umpire Rocky Roe

$3B umpire Dale Ford called Jay Bell out for passing Jose Offerman; however, Offerman had been forced out already; the umpires put Bell back on 3B; Yankees manager Joe Torre protested the game; Torre talked to the umpires the next night at the pregame meeting and told them this was one of the worst umpiring performances he had ever seen
ej,zimmd101,C,reilm901,Balk non-call $the Yankees argued that Hipolito Pichardo had balked, which would have scored the game-ending run; Yankees coach Don Zimmer ejected by HP umpire Mike Reilly
ej,torrj101,M,garcr901,During pregame meeting $Yankees manager Joe Torre was ejected by 1B umpire Richie Garcia during the pregame meeting for arguing about a play from the previous game

ej,bordm001,P,cobld901,Balls and strikes (during at bat) ej,johnd105,M,cobld901,Balls and strikes Mike Bordick ejected by HP umpire Drew Coble after arguing strike two; Orioles manager Davey Johnson also ejected by Coble
ej,staim001,P,hirsj901,Balls and strikes Matt Stairs ejected by HP umpire John Hirschbeck

$John Valentin caught the ball while diving into the seats and flipped it to Nomar Garciaparra while his feet were still in the air; Garciaparra threw the ball to Jeff Frye, who was running to cover 3B; Frye tagged Jorge Posada but Posada was awarded the base as an automatic advance since Valentin fell into a dead ball area while making the catch
